revised_title: Hormonal Control of Development in Plant Diseases
tldr: The author discusses the role of plant hormones in healthy and diseased plants, focusing on how hormonal imbalances can lead to developmental disturbances in plants. They explore the effects of certain plant diseases on stem elongation and the potential involvement of hormones like auxins, gibberellins, and inhibitors. The author also highlights the discovery of gibberellins from studying plant diseases and emphasizes the importance of further research on plant hormones in extreme habitats and diseased plants.
